JobFullDesc: Are you a skilled writer, communicator, and storyteller? Are you excited to help tell the Microsoft story and accelerate business impact through executive communications? Are you passionate about diversity & inclusion? We’re looking to hire a senior communications lead for the Office of the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) to lead both internal and external communications.   The communications lead will support communications for the CMO that are focused on diversity and inclusion. This person will also think creatively about different communications formats to inspire employees, customers, and partners. This person will coordinate with many internal and external stakeholders so they need to be a great team player, a self-starter, and experienced at creating and delivering communications content, including written, visual, and video media production.ResponsibilitiesLead the communications strategy and platform across internal and external channels for the Marketing and Consumer Business (MCB) Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). This includes a focus on building an inclusive culture, inspiring employees to live our company values and creating inclusive marketing opportunities. You’ll partner closely with our public relations (PR) agency, internal Communications team, MCB community team and your peers across Microsoft Leadership.Lead external communications for the CMO, including strategy, platform, social media, and writing thought leadership pieces. Partner across the internal and external Communications teams to align on strategy and success metrics, track progress, and adjust as needed. Craft monthly thought leadership articles, leveraging existing speech content. Evaluate external speaking opportunities for the CMO to empower companies to achieve more.Manage and create internal emails and speeches, including monthly emails to the MCB organization, customer meetings, and all hands. Partner with internal teams on exec engagement requests and deliver the best-in-class content to be most impactful for the selected audience.Manage event speeches across internal and external events. These are typically multi-month lead time events with new content and stories.Oversee the development and delivery of internal and external communications for the CMO, including briefing materials, scripting/messaging for briefing materials, scripting/messaging for internal keynotes, presentations, media engagements, social media, and events. Builds on effectiveness of previously used materials while looking for ways to be more efficient. Drives interactive engagement where appropriate.Seek out ways to improve impact of communications by collaborating across business and communications partners, attending, and getting feedback on speeches, and learning about market and business trends and strategies. Embrace a learner’s mindset to seek continual improvement and learning both for your craft and for the speeches and thought leadership pieces.Act as a trusted advisor to CMO on employee communications issues. Determines the metrics for success and the plan to measure and inform strategy by utilizing data and insights from internal surveys and feedback channels. Qualifications6+ years Integrated Marketing, Product Marketing, Communications, Marketing Operations, Field Operations, Program Management, Project Management, Public Relations, or related equivalent experience.Excellent written communications skills, both short form and long form. Excellent storytelling skills with ability to craft stories and speeches that are compelling and impactful. Ability to create clear and concise communications in the right “voice” that results in compelling presentations/emails and in meetings with employees, partners, customers, developers, and others. Ability to understand the needs of each audience (e.g., employees, key partners, customers, etc.) and create effective communications to reach those audiences. Strong collaboration capabilities across all levels and parts of Microsoft, including cross-group teams, virtual and global teams, vendors, agency partners and press. Executive maturity and presence, representing the office of the CMO with the ability to work with highly confidential information. Strong organizational skills with ability to project manage speeches and timelines. Exemplifies both the cultural attributes and leadership principles. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to adapt plans and approach. Proven track record for new, innovative approaches and smart risk taking. Strategic thinking and counsel: Ability to understand business trends, stay on top of developments and corporate strategy, and advise on communication opportunities (both planned and impromptu).  Social expertise to steer LinkedIn and Twitter campaigns focused on reaching diverse audiences for talent recruiting. Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Journalism, Marketing, Communications, Finance, or related field or equivalent work
